intro: Macrosolen tenuiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered macrolen, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
